title: language_test_4_7
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 1?

Although World War I was famously dubbed by President Woodrow Wilson ![dropdown:Drop_Down_715_94] it did anything but that.
feedback: The correct answer is “the war to end all wars,” (including quotation marks), and the sentence should read: “Although World War I was famously dubbed by President Woodrow Wilson ‘the war to end all wars,’ it did anything but that.” Since “the war to end all wars” is a quotation, it should have quotation marks around it. There should be a comma after the word “wars” because the quotation ends a dependent clause at the beginning of the sentence. The comma separates the dependent clause from the independent clause.
